body: That's quite a bit behind. Have you tried updating?

sorry, my mistake. I mixed up the versions. The "error" occurs since `catch2/2.11.3` (i.e. including `catch2/2.12.1`). Version `catch2/2.11.1` is the last that is not "affected". (`2.11.2` is not available via conan.)

Interesting, that [warning should already be suppressed](https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/blob/master/include/internal/catch_compiler_capabilities.h) since v2.12.0. Can you check why the `NOLINT` is not obeyed in your configuration?

I am not quite sure how. But maybe this error log helps? This is from version `catch2/2.12.0` but it is the very same for `catch2/2.12.1` (including the line numbers). You are right, obviously there is the `/* NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg) */` comment and I don't know why it is skipped. I cannot test it right now, but just two things that pop up to my mind: I always use `NOLINT` with `//` instead of a `/*` ... `*/` or maybe this issue is related to my old clang-tidy version [`7.0.1`](https://releases.llvm.org/7.0.0/tools/clang/tools/extra/docs/clang-tidy/index.html) ...

```
[...] tests.cpp:10:3: error: do not call c-style vararg functions [hicpp-vararg,-warnings-as-errors]
  REQUIRE(Factorial(1) == 1);
  ^
[...] catch2/catch.hpp:17394:24: note: expanded from macro 'REQUIRE'
#define REQUIRE( ... ) INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST( "REQUIRE", Catch::ResultDisposition::Normal, __VA_ARGS__  )
                       ^
[...] catch2/catch.hpp:2698:9: note: expanded from macro 'INTERNAL_CATCH_TEST'
        CATCH_INTERNAL_IGNORE_BUT_WARN(__VA_ARGS__); \
        ^
[...] catch2/catch.hpp:166:55: note: expanded from macro 'CATCH_INTERNAL_IGNORE_BUT_WARN'
#    define CATCH_INTERNAL_IGNORE_BUT_WARN(...) (void)__builtin_constant_p(__VA_ARGS__) /* NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg) */
                                                      ^
```
@moha-gh Hey, can you confirm what clang-tidy version are you running?
Ok, I will suppress the warning in both variants, and open up an issue with clang-tidy upstream.

issue.title: Catch2 causes warnings reported by clang-tidy due to its use of `var_arg`

repository.name: gui_starter_template
repository.description: A template CMake project to get you started with C++ and tooling

issue.body:
Using Catch2's `REQUIRE` triggers clang-tidy to warn about the usage of `var_arg`. Disabling `cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg` and `hicpp-vararg` globally (in .clang-tidy) or using `NOLINT` at each invocation of `REQUIRE` resolves this issue. The former is maybe the easiest solution, the latter the more accurate approach. On the other hand adding `NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg, hicpp-vararg)` to each an every `REQUIRE` call is tedious ...

**EDIT:** this problem occurs since `catch2/2.11.3` and will be fixed in future releases: [Catch2/issues/1921](https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/1921)

body:
Okay, this is now fixed in master.

I also opened two bugs in clang-tidy's bugzilla,
* [one for silencing via aliases](https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=45859)
* [one for `__builtin_constant_p`](https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=45860)

issue.title: Same bug as in the following issue https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/1921

repository.name: Catch2
repository.description: A modern, C++-native, test framework for unit-tests, TDD and BDD - using C++14, C++17 and later (C++11 support is in v2.x branch, and C++03 on the Catch1.x branch)

issue.body: Same problem as in https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/1921 with Catch2/3.0.0 from conan

issue.title: Suppressing one alias of clang-tidy warning should silence other aliases

repository.name: llvm-project
repository.description: The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and toolchain technologies.

issue.body:
|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| Bugzilla Link | [45859](https://llvm.org/bz45859) |
| Version | unspecified |
| OS | All |
| CC | @EugeneZelenko,@adzenith |

## Extended Description 
I am using `NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg)` in my code, but
`hicpp-vararg` warning is still reported by clang-tidy, even though it
is documented as alias of the former.

## Steps to reproduce

Run clang-tidy with "*-vararg" checks enabled on the following snippet
```cpp
void varargs(...) {}

void foo() {
    varargs(1, 2, 3); // NOLINT(hicpp-vararg)
}
```

The output will be 

```
/mnt/c/temp/Catch/1921.cpp:4:5: warning: do not call c-style vararg functions [cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg]
    varargs(1, 2, 3); // NOLINT(hicpp-vararg)
    ^
Suppressed 1 warnings (1 NOLINT).
```

## Expected result

I expect no warnings to be issued, because `hicpp-vararg` and
`cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg` warnings are documented to be aliases:

https://releases.llvm.org/9.0.0/tools/clang/tools/extra/docs/clang-tidy/checks/hicpp-vararg.html

I would also prefer the output to report 1 suppressed warning, but I
think reporting 2 is also acceptable.


## Other information
This came up due to an issue in Catch2's issue tracker:
https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2/issues/1921

Catch2 uses `__builtin_constant_p` to trigger warnings in unevaluated
expressions, which clang-tidy flags as use of a variadic function (I
consider this as a bug, but will open separate report for it). When
suppressed with `NOLINT(cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-vararg)`, the warning
is still triggered when user enables hicpp-vararg check.

The linked issue confirms that this replicates for clang-tidy 7 and 9,
I also reproduced the issue on clang-tidy 10.
